question:
In context of ‘Kyoto protocol’, which of the following gas (es) is/are characterised as principal greenhouse gas (es)?
1. Carbon dioxide (Co2)
2. Carbon Monoxide (Co)
3. Ozone (o3)
4. Hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs)
5. Perfluorocarbons (PFCs)
6. Sulphur hexafluoride (SF6)
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation:
The targets for the first commitment period of the Kyoto Protocol cover emissions of the six main greenhouse gases, namely:
• Carbon dioxide (CO2);
• Methane (CH4);
• Nitrous oxide (N2O);
• Hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs);
• Perfluorocarbons (PFCs); and
• Sulphur hexafluoride (SF6)
